page.title: 03St. Andrew's church,Landford
page.content: St.Andrews church was originally a Norman building built in the 13th century.On the 11th of January 1689 towards dawn ,there was a violent storm continuing to about 11 or 12 at night.It blew down a great elm tree,sold afterwards for ten pounds which was a great amount of money in those days.The tree hit the roof and damaged most of the roof.The church took 6 months to repair.In the year 1856 it was decided that there should be a new church built on the old site.On October 7th the church was finished and it cost about Â£1,500.The builder of the new church was a man called Mr.John Crook.The present vicar is also vicar of Plaitford.There is a family service at Landford on the first sunday of the month, and evensong on the other three sundays.
